DOC.brief_summary: Self-efficacy predict behavioural rehabilitation outcome may important psychological factor wheelchair mobility . A feasibility study evaluate novel self-efficacy enhance wheelchair training intervention ( WheelSee ) determine : 1.WheelSee improves self-efficacy compare standard care ; 2. study design appropriate ; 3 . The WheelSee intervention protocol suitable . This feasibility study allow study design protocol refinement provide pilot data experimental trial .
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study evaluate feasibility administer novel self-efficacy enhance wheelchair training intervention ( WheelSee ) manual wheelchair user least 19 year age . Self-efficacy wheelchair use important construct , may influence wheelchair mobility participation . Pilot data obtain study inform design experimental trial refinement WheelSee intervention protocol . This study use randomize control , single blind design sample 24 ( 12 intervention , 12 control ) . Participants randomly allocate intervention control group use computer generate table random number . Participants allocate intervention group take part WheelSee group 2-4 . The WheelSee intervention consist 6 ( twice weekly , minimum 3 day apart ) x 1.5 hour session . Participants encourage bring family member session , may act spotter practice wheelchair skill . If family member available , student volunteer spotter available ensure 1:1 spotter : wheelchair user ratio . All spotter train appropriate spotting technique .
DOC.criteria: 19 year age old Reside community Daily use manual wheelchair ( â‰¥ 2 hours/day ) Able selfpropel ( use combination hand foot ) distance 10 Would like improve confidence use manual wheelchair Have wheelchair mobility goal Able read , write speak Grade 8 English level Score 25 high Mini Mental State Examination ( MMSE ) Have previously currently take part standardize wheelchair training Are acutely ill
